com.cloudera.oryx.common.io

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.common.io.IOUtils

  • public final class IOUtils
extends Object
    I/O-related utility methods.

    • Method Detail

      • deleteRecursively

        public static void deleteRecursively(Path rootDir)
                              throws IOException
        Deletes the given path, and if it is a directory, all files and subdirectories within it.
        Parameters:
        rootDir - directory to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - if any error occurs while deleting files or directories

      • readMaybeCompressed

        public static InputStream readMaybeCompressed(Path file)
                                       throws IOException
        Opens an InputStream to the file. If it appears to be compressed, because its file name ends in ".gz" or ".zip", then it will be decompressed accordingly.
        Parameters:
        file - file, possibly compressed, to open
        Returns:
        InputStream on uncompressed contents
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream can't be opened or is invalid or can't be read

      • readLines

        public static Iterable<String> readLines(Path file)
        Parameters:
        file - file to read lines of, which may be compressed. It will be read using UTF-8 encoding and assumes line separators consistent with BufferedReader
        Returns:
        an Iterable over the lines of the file

      • writeMaybeCompressed

        public static OutputStream writeMaybeCompressed(Path file,
                                int bufferSize)
                                         throws IOException
        Opens an OutputStream to the file. If it should be compressed, because its file name ends in ".gz" or ".zip", then data written will be compressed accordingly.
        Parameters:
        file - file, possibly compressed, to write to
        bufferSize - suggested output buffer size in bytes
        Returns:
        OutputStream receiving uncompressed contents
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream can't be opened or is invalid or can't be written

      • listFiles

        public static List<Path> listFiles(Path dir,
                   String glob)
                            throws IOException
        Parameters:
        dir - directory to list
        glob - glob pattern for files that should be returned, which can span subdirectories as in patterns like * /*
        Returns:
        Paths, including both files and directories, matching the glob pattern. No path containing an element whose name starts with "." is returned. Returned paths are also ordered lexicographically.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while accessing the file system

      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(Closeable closeable)
        Closes a Closeable and logs the exception, if any. This is only suitable for closing objects where a failure to close does not impact correctness -- for example, an input stream that is already fully read, but not an output stream which may fail when flushing final output.
        Parameters:
        closeable - thing to close

      • chooseFreePort

        public static int chooseFreePort()
                          throws IOException
        Binds to a free ephemeral port, and then releases it. The returned port is quite likely to be free for use after this, but is not entirely guaranteed to be.
        Returns:
        a (probably) free ephemeral port
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while binding to a port
